alert.note: Alert for Clarendon; Lee; Sumter (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 10:01PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Lee, northern Clarendon and northeastern Sumter Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 1001 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bishopville, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bishopville, Lee State Park, Woods Bay State Park, Sumter County Airport, Elliott, Mayesville, Lynchburg, Ashwood, Oswego, Dalzell, Manville, St. Charles, Shiloh, Wisacky, Woodrow, and Ashland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 113 and 126. Interstate 95 between mile markers 137 and 146. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
